text: Barbara-Rose Collins (April 13, 1939 â€“ November 4, 2021) was an American Democratic politician. She was the first black woman from Michigan to be elected to Congress. She was a member of the United States House of Representatives from 1991 until 1997. Collins was born in Detroit, Michigan. Collins died on November 4, 2021 at a Detroit hospital from problems caused by COVID-19, aged 82. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1939 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Detroit Category:United States representatives from Michigan Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Politicians from Detroit Category:African-American politicians
title: Barbara-Rose Collins
